result.execSummary:
The defendant Tramaile A Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary. Random urine screens.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tramaile A Evans

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (17 pages) commencing NOVEMBER 23, 2015 received and filed. kl

Defendant Tramaile A Evans in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Tramaile A Evans in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court has reviewed defense social history report.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

As to Count 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3.5 YEARS CONCURRENT with Count 3; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.
As to Count 3:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3.5 YEARS CONCURRENT with Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.
These sentences are CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
Court allows 206 days credit.
Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.
  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs
- Random urine screens
- Seek and maintain full-time employment and/or school
- referral to the Department of Vocational Rehabilitation
- Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Pay DNA surcharges on Count 1 and waives the DNA surcharge on Count 3 due to imposition of costs and DNA surcharge on Count 1;
Pay all court costs;
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  The Court ordered that all court costs, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit  Court orders no other specific programming conditions.
Per Chief Judge Directive 15-19, case is judicially transferred.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Tramaile A Evans not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl for Hanna Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is scheduled for sentencing hearing. Court is in trial, spin court is not available.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tramaile A Evans in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Tramaile A Evans in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNTS 1 and 3. On motion of the State, Court orders COUNT 2 DISMISSED AND READ-IN. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court orders defendant REMANDED pending sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Ineligibile Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Tramaile A Evans not in court, in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.    All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Tramaile A Evans not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-11-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tramaile A Evans in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Tramaile A Evans in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Daniel Keller-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tramaile A Evans in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Tramaile A Evans in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
